Is Xerath supposed to be a villain or not? You said that this wasn't supposed to be a black and white, Azir-good Xerath-evil story, but then you claimed that Xerath won in the fight with Nasus 'because the good guys can't win at the beginning'.
Considering Xerath destroyed Shurima just killed off an entire city (or most of it)twisted renekton's mind and is trying to kill off sivir. I think we can call xerath evil.
As annoying as that would be, that'd be fine. But Riot seems to insist on trying to paint this as a grey conflict, and it's clearly not.

I think Riot believes that giving him the sad backstory of being a slave who just wanted his freedom is supposed to add the grey factor in. But, it's safe to assume that they included enough of his atrocities into the stories to see that he is truly not a good guy (he murdered any mage who was his equal, smote the queen and the king, set a deliberate trap for Renekton and Nasus just so he could steal the ascension, etc., he is not nice)

Is it just me or does it feel like Nasus was made weaker for the sake of making Xereth stronger or something? Idk it just feels that way to me

It makes perfect sense within the story: In the past, Nasus couldn't completely defeat Xerath even with Renekton's help, the two of them only managing to seal him away with Renekton's sacrifice. 

Now Nasus is fighting Xerath ALONE after centuries (maybe millennia) of wallowing in self-pity, presumably not getting any training done. So if he couldn't beat Xerath in the past with help, when he was at his best, he wouldn't have a chance now that he's on his own.

EDIT: Not to mention, Xerath had JUST ascended when Nasus first fought him: He's had plenty of time since then to get used to his Ascended body, and become more comfortable using the sheer amount of magic he possesses now. It'd be safe to say he'd be even STRONGER than when they first fought.
